node_detail_info.title: EU announces new sanctions against Russia amid Ukraine war
node_detail_info.lines: The package also extends the list of controlled items, which may contribute to Russia's military and technological enhancement or the development of its defence and security sector, thereby reinforcing export controls on dual-use and advanced technology.   "With a view to avoid any potential negative consequences for food and energy security around the world, the EU decided to extend the exemption from the prohibition to engage in transactions with certain state-owned entities as regards transactions for agricultural products and the transport of oil to third countries," the EU council statement said.

related_infos.title: Ukraine asks US to impose sanctions on all Russian banks
related_infos.lines: As soon as one bank is sanctioned, some other private bank suddenly becomes a financier of the industry or military, she requested, noting that shes also pushing for the State Department to designate Russia as a state sponsor of terrorism.   She informed the media outlet that the administration of President Vladimir Zelensky desires the US to add a few banks each week to its list of designated financial institutions. The ambassador stated that she has informed the US Treasury Department of the request.

node_detail_info.title: Zelensky lists red lines for talks with Russia
node_detail_info.lines: There will be no more peace talks with Russia if Ukrainian POWs are subjected to a "show trial," Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky has said.   DPR head Denis Pushilin told TASS news agency this month that "active preparations" for the tribunal were underway. "The first tribunal will most likely be held in Mariupol. It will be organized by the end of summer," he said.

related_infos.title: Zelensky warns against putting NeoNazis on trial
related_infos.lines: The authorities of the Donetsk People's Republic DPR have previously said that they are planning tribunals for suspected war crimes committed by Ukrainian troops, including members of the Neo-Nazi Azov Battalion, whose ranks include Hitler-sympathizerswith openly ultra-nationalist views.   Russia will "cut itself off" from talks if Azov fighters are prosecuted in Donbass, Ukrainian president insists

node_detail_info.title: HIMARS stockpiles destroyed Moscow
node_detail_info.lines: Storage facilities containing missiles for HIMARS multiple rocket launchers and shells for M777 howitzers were targeted, the ministry announced on Monday.   A shipment station outside Bogdanovtsy village, which hosted the munitions, was hit with "sea-based high-precision long-range weapons," it added.

node_detail_info.title: Live Turkey says three grain ships to leave Ukraine on Friday
node_detail_info.lines: The Senate voted 95 to 1 in favor of the two Nordic countries' accession, making the United States the 23rd of the 30 NATO countries to formally endorse it so far, after Italy approved it earlier Wednesday and France on Tuesday.   Akar also said an empty ship was expected to head towards Ukraine after being inspected in Istanbul. The statement said Akar had held talks with Ukraine's defence and infrastructure ministers to discuss the situation around grain deliveries.

related_infos.title: Zelensky reveals value of Russian assets seized by Ukraine
related_infos.lines: The Ukrainian president said Kiev has already confiscated over $700 million and more is coming   "Held a meeting today on sanctions policy, confiscation of Russian assets. As government officials reported, assets worth 28 billion hryvnias about $765 million have already been forcibly seized. This work continues. More than 900 more facilities belonging to the Russian state are proposed to be confiscated. And if we evaluate the property package not only of the Russian state, but also of its residents, we are talking about 36 thousand items to be seized," he stated.

related_infos.title: Saudis buy stake in Russian energy companies spend billions
related_infos.lines: Following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine on 24th February, many Western nations imposed sanctions on Russian energy firms and their executives.   Saudi Arabia and Russia lead the OPEC group, an alliance formed between the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries OPEC and other producers in 2017.

node_detail_info.title: Russian troops detain spies at Europes largest nuclear power station
node_detail_info.lines: "Apart from that, a violator of access control to the plant, an accomplice of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, who transmitted the coordinates of the movement of columns of Russian military hardware, has been detained," they added.   Two workers at the Zaporozhye plant have been providing information to Ukraine's forces, the Russian National Guard has said

node_detail_info.title: Russia arrests two staffs in Ukraine
node_detail_info.lines: After taking control of the power station on March 4, Russian troops have arrested 26 violators of access control to the plant  the biggest nuclear power plant in Europe, the National Guard publicized. The facility carries on working with local staff, while Russian troops patrol the buildings and check for explosive devices and unexploded munitions, the National Guard said.
